item.title: Links for November 19th through November 25th
item.dc:creator: Michael McCracken
item.description:
My shared links for November 19th through November 25th:

  • Norway: an Eden with wifi - FT.com - "Visiting Norway during the global crisis felt like prosperity tourism, or "wealth porn"."

  • The Axis of Eval: The extensible way of thinking - An interesting way of looking at requiring types: it hampers extensibilityâ€¦

  • U1DB in Launchpad - Potential replacement for desktopcouch

  • How John Got 15x Improvement Without Really Trying (Compile My Code) -

item.title: Links for September 27th through October 14th
item.dc:creator: Michael McCracken
item.description:
My shared links for September 27th through October 14th:

  • pyprocessing - A Processing-like environment for doing graphics with Python - Google Project Hosting - processing in python. uses pyglet. installs very easily

  • Common Errors in Technical Writing - A list of common errors and peeves in technical writing. Very useful.

  • Renaissance: Harness Emergence to Avoid the Concurrency Trap - Languages for non-deterministic computing, and a manycore squeak VM

  • Geek's Guide to Portland 2011 - Waxy.org -

  • Candyspotting - Houndstooth Snowsuit Card - Holiday -

  • LLVM Project Blog: Greedy Register Allocation in LLVM 3.0 -

  • CUergo: Sitting and Standing - Short version: sit at your desk, but get up every 20 minutes and move around for 2 minutes. That's probably a good time to focus your eyes somewhere else too.

  • pandas: powerful Python data analysis toolkit -- pandas v0.4.0 documentation - python package for labeled multidimensional data
